definition: silvery spear point actually made of pewter (idiom); fig. worthless despite an attractive exterior
pewter (alloy of tin 錫|锡, lead 鉛|铅 and other metals)
thin foil to make paper money for the dead

sentences.english: Handcrafted in the U. S. A with 100% lead-free pewter.
sentences.chinese: 美国手工制作，材质为100%无铅白镴。
美国手工制造，100%无铅白镴。

sentences.english: Handcrafted in the U. S. A with 100% lead-free pewter. Learn More.
sentences.chinese: 美国手工制作，材质为100%无铅白镴。

sentences.english: This trendy pewter pendant makes a strong statement about your personal commitment to purity.
sentences.chinese: 这款时尚白镴坠炼为您守贞的承诺立下有力的声明。

sentences.english: In the museum we saw antique pewter plates.
sentences.chinese: 我们在博物馆看到古时的白镴盘子。

sentences.english: She also imported Italian straw baskets and did a little pewter work.
sentences.chinese: 她还买进一些意大利草篮，自制白镴器皿。

sentences.english: Pewter dates back at least 2,000 years, to Roman times.
sentences.chinese: 白镴可以追溯到最少2，000年前的罗马时代。

definition: pile of earth to keep wine jars
to travel by the light of torch
a traditional pastry of Taiwan and Fujian which is fried, then coated with maltose and rolled in sesame seeds or chopped peanuts etc/Taiwan pr. [lao3]
phonetic component in certain characters with sound huò, such as 護, 獲, 穫 and 擭
ancient ballista for throwing heavy stones/variant of 炮[pao4], cannon
a drum-shaped rattle (used by peddlers or as a toy)/rattle-drum
